com.vaadin.fluent.api

Interface FluentTree<THIS extends FluentTree<THIS,ITEM>,ITEM>

  • Type Parameters:
    THIS - Self-referential generic THIS
    ITEM - the item object type in the listing
    All Superinterfaces:
    com.vaadin.server.ClientConnector, com.vaadin.ui.Component, com.vaadin.shared.Connector, com.vaadin.event.ContextClickEvent.ContextClickNotifier, FluentAbstractComponent<THIS>, FluentClientConnector<THIS>, FluentComponent<THIS>, FluentComposite<THIS>, FluentContextClickNotifier<THIS>, FluentHasComponents<THIS>, FluentHasDataProvider<THIS,ITEM>, FluentHasHierarchicalDataProvider<THIS,ITEM>, FluentHasItems<THIS,ITEM>, FluentSizeable<THIS>, com.vaadin.ui.HasComponents, com.vaadin.data.HasDataProvider<ITEM>, com.vaadin.data.HasHierarchicalDataProvider<ITEM>, com.vaadin.data.HasItems<ITEM>, Iterable<com.vaadin.ui.Component>, Serializable, com.vaadin.server.Sizeable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    FTree

    public interface FluentTree<THIS extends FluentTree<THIS,ITEM>,ITEM>
extends FluentComposite<THIS>, FluentHasHierarchicalDataProvider<THIS,ITEM>
    The base interface for fluent versions of Tree
    See Also:
    Tree

      • withItemClickListener

        default THIS withItemClickListener(com.vaadin.ui.Tree.ItemClickListener<ITEM> listener)
        Adds an item click listener. The listener is called when an item of this Tree is clicked.
        Parameters:
        listener - the item click listener, not null
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        Tree.addItemClickListener(ItemClickListener)

      • withSelectionListener

        default THIS withSelectionListener(com.vaadin.event.selection.SelectionListener<ITEM> listener)
                            throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Adds a selection listener to the current selection model.

        NOTE: If selection mode is switched with Tree.setSelectionMode(Grid.SelectionMode), then this listener is not triggered anymore when selection changes!

        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to add
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if selection has been disabled with Grid.SelectionMode.NONE
        See Also:
        Tree.addSelectionListener(SelectionListener)

      • withAutoRecalculateWidth

        default THIS withAutoRecalculateWidth(boolean autoRecalculateWidth)
        Sets the automatic width recalculation on or off. This feature is on by default.
        Parameters:
        autoRecalculateWidth - true to enable recalculation; false to turn it off
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        Tree.setAutoRecalculateWidth(boolean)

        Parameters:
        contentMode - the content mode
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:

      • withDataProvider

        default THIS withDataProvider(com.vaadin.data.provider.DataProvider<ITEM,?> dataProvider)
        Description copied from interface: FluentHasDataProvider
        Sets the data provider for this listing. The data provider is queried for displayed items as needed.

        Parameters:
        dataProvider - the data provider, not null

      • withItemCaptionGenerator

        default THIS withItemCaptionGenerator(com.vaadin.ui.ItemCaptionGenerator<ITEM> captionGenerator)
        Sets the item caption generator that is used to produce the strings shown as the text for each item. By default, String.valueOf(Object) is used.
        Parameters:
        captionGenerator - the item caption provider to use, not null
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        Tree.setItemCaptionGenerator(ItemCaptionGenerator)

      • withItemCollapseAllowedProvider

        default THIS withItemCollapseAllowedProvider(com.vaadin.ui.ItemCollapseAllowedProvider<ITEM> provider)
        Sets the item collapse allowed provider for this Tree. The provider should return true for any item that the user can collapse.

        Note: This callback will be accessed often when sending data to the client. The callback should not do any costly operations.

        Parameters:
        provider - the item collapse allowed provider, not null
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        Tree.setItemCollapseAllowedProvider(ItemCollapseAllowedProvider)

      • withItemIconGenerator

        default THIS withItemIconGenerator(com.vaadin.ui.IconGenerator<ITEM> iconGenerator)
        Sets the item icon generator that is used to produce custom icons for items. The generator can return null for items with no icon.
        Parameters:
        iconGenerator - the item icon generator to set, not null
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if itemIconGenerator is null
        See Also:
        IconGenerator, Tree.setItemIconGenerator(IconGenerator)

      • withRowHeight

        default THIS withRowHeight(double rowHeight)
        Sets the height of a row. If -1 (default), the row height is calculated based on the theme for an empty row before the Tree is displayed.
        Parameters:
        rowHeight - The height of a row in pixels or -1 for automatic calculation
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        Tree.setRowHeight(double)

      • withSelectionMode

        default THIS withSelectionMode(com.vaadin.ui.Grid.SelectionMode selectionMode)
        Sets the tree's selection mode.

        The built-in selection modes are:

        • Grid.SelectionMode.SINGLE the default model
        • Grid.SelectionMode.MULTI
        • Grid.SelectionMode.NONE preventing selection
        Parameters:
        selectionMode - the selection mode to switch to, not null
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        Tree.setSelectionMode(Grid.SelectionMode), Grid.SelectionMode

      • withStyleGenerator

        default THIS withStyleGenerator(com.vaadin.ui.StyleGenerator<ITEM> styleGenerator)
        Sets the style generator that is used for generating class names for items in this tree. Returning null from the generator results in no custom style name being set.
        Parameters:
        styleGenerator - the item style generator to set, not null
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if styleGenerator is null
        See Also:
        StyleGenerator, Tree.setStyleGenerator(StyleGenerator)
